snippet: A fast-growing Christian movement in the United States has revived debate about ethical practices in intercountry adoptions.
abstract: Evangelical Christians are part of a fast-growing movement that promotes adoption as a religious and moral calling;  supporters say surge in adoptions has offered hope to thousands of parent-less or abandoned children from abroad and to foster children in the United States; movement has revived debate about ethical practices in international adoptions.
lead_paragraph: A fast-growing Christian movement in the United States has revived debate about ethical practices in intercountry adoptions.

headline.seo: Eager to Adopt, Evangelicals Find Children, and Pitfalls, Abroad
headline.main: Eager to Adopt, Evangelicals Find Perils Abroad
headline.print_headline: Eager to Adopt, Evangelicals Find Perils Abroad
